definition: to enter deeply into people's hearts/to have a real impact on the people (idiom)
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: Mediation priority, early prevention, public power dominant the social security are essential Countermeasure.
sentences.chinese: 讓公權力主導社會安全的理念深入人心是基本對策。

sentences.english: In Japan, the brand, Zojirushi, which represents comfort has been impressed on everyone.
sentences.chinese: 在日本，這個代表着舒適的象印商標已深入人心。

sentences.english: For their part, railguns have been around for nearly a century.
sentences.chinese: 對於他們來說，軌道炮一個世紀以來早已深入人心。

sentences.english: As well known barrels water has truck root in people's heart.
sentences.chinese: 衆所周知桶裝水已深入人心。

sentences.english: There is no theory which could go deep into human's mind except animism.
sentences.chinese: 沒有一種理論能像泛靈論這樣深入人心。

sentences.english: The first legacy is the concept of “Great Unity” so entrenched in Chinese people’s minds.
sentences.chinese: 首先是深入人心的中華民族“大一統”觀念。

sentences.english: The concept of promoting development and security through cooperation has taken a deeper root in the hearts of all.
sentences.chinese: 以合作促發展，以合作謀安全的理念更加深入人心。

sentences.english: The difficult path of witness that goes deep can be helpful to many people.
sentences.chinese: 深入人心的見證不容易作，卻能造益許多人。

sentences.english: It was really drilled home the importance of studying mathematics and physics.
sentences.chinese: 學習數學以及物理知識的重要性已經深入人心。

sentences.english: Women's movement has not really penetrated here.
sentences.chinese: 婦女運動在這裏還沒有真正深入人心。

sentences.english: He said China-Nepal friendship has been deeply rooted in the hearts of the two peoples.
sentences.chinese: 他說，中尼友好深入人心。

sentences.english: Co-evolution was on the minds of the discoverers.
sentences.chinese: 聯合進化已經在發現者們中間深入人心。

sentences.english: Meanwhile, a different form of populism was taking root.
sentences.chinese: 與此同時，一種不同形式的平民主義開始深入人心。

definition: understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to model/to mold/(fig.) to create (a character, a market, an image etc)/(literature) to portray (in words)
what's frequently heard can be repeated in detail (idiom)
understood by everyone (idiom); well known/a household name
to interpret/to comment and explain/to annotate/to perform (i.e. interpret a theatrical role)/to decode/interpretation/annotation
role/character in a novel/persona/also pr. [jiao3 se4]
(of an actor) to bring (one's character) to life/to act brilliantly
to play the role of/to act
